data.text: The words of the Preacher, the son of David, king of Israel in Jerusalem.
Vanity of vanities, said the Preacher,
What advantage is there to a man
A generation goes, and a generation comes:
And the sun arises, and the sun goes down
All the rivers run into the sea;
All things are full of labor;
What is that which has been? the very thing which shall be:
Who is he that shall speak and say, Behold, this is new?
There is no memorial to the first things;
And I applied my heart to seek out
That which is crooked cannot be made straight:
I spoke in my heart, saying,
And my heart knew muchâ€”wisdom, and knowledge,
For in the abundance of wisdom is abundance of knowledge;
